Name: ファー!!っていうゲーム (A Game to Yell FORE!!)
Description:
This is a freebie game from Toryo Hojo designed to bring golf to your tabletop.

Players play either a single hole or a series of holes, using handfuls of dice to make shots, with your number rolled indicating the flight of the ball. If playing the full game, players choose only a few clubs to bring to the links and must compete with only the dice recipes for those clubs. The tee and hazard locations move based on the holes.

This was distributed as part of the Spring 2021 Market Crash pack and players must provide their own playing pieces.

Name: München live
Description:
Munich live includes questions from 5 categories (nightlife, lifestyle, hotels, shopping and culinary). Furthermore, you have to assess the other players on these topics.
The highlight of the game are 4 champagne glasses in which the victory points (glass marbles) are collected. The player who fills his glass first wins the game.

—user summary

Name: York Clubhouse Golf
Description:
Clubhouse style golfing in the comfort of your own home, brought to you by York Air Conditioning. Printed and published in Chicago by Stephens, Biondi, & De Cicco Inc. for York Air Conditioning in 1962, York Clubhouse Golf features an 18-hole course for you and up to 5 others to enjoy. York Clubhouse Golf uses pushpins to mark ball locations and a variety of dice to swing with including:
White - shot direction and accuracy
Red - driving
Yellow x2 - used together for chipping and pitching
Blue - mid to low ranges
Green x2 - used together from outer green putting, or singly for inner green

—user summary

Name: TrumPen
Description:
TrumPen is a card game system that uses dry erase cards for players to write the suit and rank on the cards themselves. The game comes with four rulesets for different games to play with these unique cards.

In TrumPen Poker, you mark 5 cards while trying to avoid duplicating cards with the other players. If the same cards are written by multiple players, the player with stronger hands will be eliminated from the game. Among the remaining players, the player with the strongest hands wins.

In TrumPen Blackjack, you collect played cards so that the sum of the numbers you have is as close to 21 as possible. You score points depending on the sum of the numbers you have. The winner is decided after 3 rounds.

In TrumPen Trick Taking, you play 3 tricks per round for 3 rounds, therefore you play 9 tricks in total and score the points.  Write down the numbers to 3 cards when they are dealt, then write the suit when you play. This is a trick-taking game with must-follow, no trump, and no bidding.

In TrumPen Speed, you play your cards in a way that cards are stacked in sequential order as quickly as possible. The player who played all of their cards first wins.

Name: Treis Kai Deka
Description:
The players use game tokens with printed on card symbols. The tokens may be combined with wooden shells of four different colors (white, black, red, green). The colors are used to represent player colors or different values.

There are 7 different games in 25 variants possible, mostly adapted from Halma and Asalto. In most games the players have to get from one corner of the game board to another corner. The seven Games are:

1. Turnierspiele
2. Besetzungsspiele
3. Nullspiele
4. Metadorspiele
5. Angriff und Verteidigung
6. Kleeblattspiele
7. Doppellauf

Name: Roller Ball
Description:
A player places a ball in the start position and proceeds to guide the ball through the maze using two control knobs which tilt the maze in all directions. If the ball falls into a hole, the score is the number beside the hole. The other players then play, highest score wins.

—user summary

Name: Euclio Bold!
Description:
The third expansion to Euclio, Euclio Bold! adds five new scoring boards and accompanying suit cards to make your games even more varied and interesting.

Some of the new boards are a bit more complex, therefore recommended for Euclio veterans, but all retain the general simplicity of play Euclio has always had.

Euclio Bold! adds a race track, new scoring spaces on cards themselves, a shared rondel, and a deadly gamble with the purple skull suit. True to the name, these suits include additional interaction points for players to navigate each other's plans as well as their own. Simply add to your Euclio box and experience a new mixture of boards and suits!

—description from the designer

Name: Adeptus Titanicus: The Horus Heresy – Rulebook
Description:
The galaxy is in flames. The Emperor’s glorious vision for Humanity is in ruins, His armies locked in brutal civil war. The greatest of these bitter combatants are the towering god-engines of the Adeptus Titanicus. Those Titan Legions that remain loyal to the Emperor of Mankind fight boldly to stem the tide of treachery, holding the line on countless worlds as the Warmaster’s forces advance inexorably on Terra. The Traitor Titan Orders march at the vanguard of the Warmaster’s hosts as they seek to bring the Imperium to its knees in the name of their twisted cause…

Adeptus Titanicus is a tabletop game of devastating combat between awe-inspiring god-machines, set during the civil war that tore the galaxy apart. Two players take control of a variety of Titans – colossal, bipedal war engines covered in thick armour and weapons which can level a city in a single salvo. It's a strategic challenge in which you pit your skill and cunning against your opponent in a battle to the death; a test of tactical skill demanding the management of the resources at your disposal, determining the optimal reactions to the evolving state of the battlefield.

This hardback rulebook is your guide to the game, packed with all the rules you need to get started. Grab this, a handful of Titans, and some accessories, and your conquest of the galaxy can begin!

CONTENTS
This 96-page hardback book contains:

     The Imperium of Mankind: an overview of the galaxy, the Titan Legions, and the Horus Heresy
     Notable Engine Wars: A record of infamous Titan battles from the Age of Darkness
     Basic Rules: The key rules you need to play the game, from rounds and phases to movement, combat and damage, plus the Titanic Clash mission to get you started
     Advanced Rules: Expanded rules for experienced players, including Orders, Stratagems, and how to use squadrons of Titans and support Banners of Imperial Knights
     Optional Rules: Additional ways to play that add complexity for a richer experience, including transferring power, overloading void shields, and stray shots
     Assembling a Battlegroup: How to build your army, including a variety of maniples and personal traits for your Princeps Seniores
     Fighting a Battle: An explanation of Open, Narrative, and Matched Play, advice on choosing missions, setting up the battlefield, and selecting Stratagems
     Missions: Six missions which can be used for Open Play or Narrative Play games, each based on an historic battle
     Matched Play: How to play balanced competitive games, including the Meeting Engagement mission, different types of deployment, and victory conditions
     Legions of the Adeptus Titanicus: Descriptions and rules for Legio Gryphonicus and Legio Tempestus, each with its own Legion Trait, specific wargear, and choice of Princeps Seniores’ personal trait


The book also includes a range of artwork, including annotated schematics of a variety of Titans, and colour examples of Titan and Knight heraldry.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Adeptus Titanicus – The Horus Heresy (Games Workshop)

Name: Koniki!
Description:
On the nearby meadow a competition in horse jumping is being held. Pick your horse, pick your rider and compete! The player with highest score will gain a trophy and the title of the Master of a Meadow. Will you jump only over small puddles, or over the fence behind the barn? It all depends on your strategy and a bit of luck.

The modular board makes each play unique. Horse jumping obstacles have different score and player decide on which one to try. The dice roll reveals if it will succeed or no and if it will be possible to jump over more obstacles in one turn. The game develops the math and strategy skills for young children.

Bright colors and easy rules makes this game fit for the young kids like preschoolers and early schoolers.

Name: Blood Bowl: Second Season Edition – Frank 'n' Stein: Star Player
Description:
Finding out about this Star Player’s early career can be tricky, because once you go back far enough he starts appearing under two different names. That’s because it wasn’t until an unlucky run-in with an ambitious Necromancer that decidedly average players Franklyn Smyth and Steiner S. Scottward became more than the sum of their parts.

After an illustrious career with his ‘repossessed’ team, Frank ‘n’ Stein was chased away from the Blood Bowl pitch after an unfortunate lightning strike sent him into a berserk frenzy, killing four players, a referee, and scores of unlucky bystanders. In a shocking twist, after his hugely popular Cabalvision commercials for Lightningade Electrolyte Drink, fans put down their pitchforks and he now plays for whoever can pay him the most.

As if his huge and powerful frame wasn’t good enough at stopping the opposing team dead in their tracks, the big lug’s brutal play style often rears its head when an unfortunate soul he’s grabbed gets an extra-large kicking.

Combined with Steiner’s size and Franklyn’s keen tactical mind, Frank ‘n’ Stein is an extremely dependable rock around which many Blood Bowl teams have been built – at least the ones able to pay his 250,000 GP fee. The Sylvanian Spotlight and Old World Classic teams that take him on will be glad to know he’s sticking around for the long haul, what with the Regeneration and Thick Skull abilities keeping him in the game.

The sky’s starting to look a bit cloudy, and I don’t want to be around the next time a lightning strike finds him, so it’s back to you in the commentary box, Jim and Bob.

—description from the publisher

Name: Hecatomb: Last Hallow's Eve
Description:
Released on October 28, 2005, this expansion added 144 cards to the base Hecatomb collectible card game, using the same themes from the base set.

The base game description via the Wizards of the Coast website:

In Hecatomb, each player is an Endbringer, an evil genius bent on the destruction of the modern-day world. Endbringers summon monsters from myth and nightmare, breeding hybrids that can destroy an enemy's forces, eventually building up enough power to destroy the world. After a world is destroyed, the Endbringers travel through dimensional portals to other, parallel worlds where the contest begins again.

Hecatomb's unusual stacking mechanic gives the game a three-dimensional feel. Five-sided Hecatomb cards depict a variety of horrid creatures, from terrible beasts and demons to crazed shamans. Cards feature four clear edges, with scores for power and abilities on the fifth edge. Players can create frightening creature hybrids called Abominations by stacking cards on top of each other. Each Abomination combines the powers and special abilities of all the creatures used to assemble it. The clear edges allow players to see the total power scores and abilities of up to 5 cards stacked together.

Hecatomb was discontinued as of 5/24/2006.

Name: Hecatomb: Blanket of Lies
Description:
Released on February 24, 2006, this expansion added 72 cards to the base Hecatomb collectible card game, with a theme of extraterrestrial invasion.

The base game description via the Wizards of the Coast website:

In Hecatomb, each player is an Endbringer, an evil genius bent on the destruction of the modern-day world. Endbringers summon monsters from myth and nightmare, breeding hybrids that can destroy an enemy's forces, eventually building up enough power to destroy the world. After a world is destroyed, the Endbringers travel through dimensional portals to other, parallel worlds where the contest begins again.

Hecatomb's unusual stacking mechanic gives the game a three-dimensional feel. Five-sided Hecatomb cards depict a variety of horrid creatures, from terrible beasts and demons to crazed shamans. Cards feature four clear edges, with scores for power and abilities on the fifth edge. Players can create frightening creature hybrids called Abominations by stacking cards on top of each other. Each Abomination combines the powers and special abilities of all the creatures used to assemble it. The clear edges allow players to see the total power scores and abilities of up to 5 cards stacked together.

Hecatomb was discontinued as of 5/24/2006.

Name: Bolt Action: Banzai! Japanese Starter Army
Description:
The contents of the Banzai! Japanese Starter Army box were based on the following Bolt Action 1,000 point Imperial Japanese army list:

     Rikugun Chui (First Lieutenant) and two soldiers Regular* 95 pts
     IJA Infantry Squad Regular (10 men with SMG and LMG)* 123 pts
     IJA Infantry Squad Regular (10 men with SMG and LMG)* 123 pts
     IJA Infantry Squad Regular (10 men with SMG and LMG)* 123 pts
     IJA Grenadier squad Regular (14 men with SMG and 3 light mortars)* 218 pts
     Suicide anti-tank team Regular (one man with lunge mine)* 20 pts
     Suicide anti-tank team Regular (one man with lunge mine)* 20 pts
     Medium Machine Gun team Regular 50 pts
     Medium Mortar team Regular 65 pts
     Veteran Chi-Ha medium tank 162 pts Total: 999 pts


– Description from the publisher

Name: Kontraband: More Salvage and Survival
Description:
KONTRABAND - More Salvage and Survival - An expansion for Osprey Wargames Zona Alfa, Salvage and Survival in the Exclusion Zone.

Designed for Solo and Cooperative games, Kontraband introduces more detail for player characters, new equipment, new enemies, and mission objectives. 
With a five-part sample campaign - Zone Ravens - it's time for your Veterans to explore high-threat locations deep in the Exclusion Zone.

Grab your gear. The Zone is calling.

NOTE: This is not a stand-alone game. You need the Zona Alfa rules to use this book.

– Description from the publisher

Name: Fishin'
Description:
Fish from your pond, another player's pond and the Secret Fishin' Hole.

Catch the most Fishin' points in 3 rounds.

The game includes 15 different types of fish cards with values of either 1, 5, 10, 15, 20 or 25. There are also 6 MINE!, 6 SNAG! and 1 Old Boot card.

Players have a "fishing pond" in front of them (5 face down cards) plus the draw pile. They start with a hand of 5 cards and on their turn they do one of the following:

     Choose the top card from the discard pile
     Choose the top card from the Draw Pile
     Choose any face up card in another players pond if it makes an immediate match 


Players then place any match in their hand into their Catch Basket. They end their turn by flipping one card from their Pond face up.

MINE! and SNAG! cards can be played one per round and allow the player to hinder other players.

The game lasts 3 rounds and the player with the highest score in their Catch Basket wins the game.

Name: Nobles
Description:
The nobles come to your court to enjoy the fineries you offer, and you will use them to better the county.

In Nobles, you control the fate of your lands.  Using the abilities of the Nobles in your audience, you complete Events.  Each Noble offers two different abilities: one at the beginning of the turn, and one when they are discarded.  Each Event requires a toll, in the form of Nobles.

There is no winning or losing in Nobles; there is only prestige.  At the end of the game (when a single Noble deck and/or Event deck is empty), you score Prestige for the Events you completed.

Nobles is a single deck solo card game consisting of 54 cards.

—description from the designer

Name: Speedo
Description:
Speedo is a three-player group size game similar to Spao, involving both removal and placement each turn for a deeper game.
Start: The board starts empty. White places a white ball on any hole.
Play: Players take turns:

     removing a movable ball of any colour, and
     placing two balls (one of each colour not removed) at any two playable points.


End: The game ends when the pyramid is completed. Each player counts the sizes of their visibly connected groups and multiplies their counts together. Highest score wins.

Like Spao, each game will last exactly 30 moves. Unlike Spao, hidden connections do not count, and the combined removal and double placement leads to more complex and dynamic board positions.

Name: Quest for the Lost Pixel: Hack Slash Loot
Description: This expansion comes with a ton of new content and new mini games to keep the game fresh and funky every time you play it. You will be greeted by 3 new heroes: Rogue, Brawler, and the Artificer. There are also new dungeon tiles to explore, events to defeat, more pets to love, and spells to learn.

Name: Tussie Mussie: Flower Shoppe – Customers
Description:
You’re working alone in the back of the shoppe when you hear the familiar chime of the front door. A customer! Let’s hope they’re in a buying mood. The last one only browsed for ages. A large order now might set you up nicely for the rest of the day...

Tussie Mussie: Flower Shoppe Customers expands on the solo play of Tussie Mussie: Flower Shoppe with 6 new cards. Mike Mullins (Bottom of the 9th, Pentaquark) did such a fantastic job capturing the feel of the multiplayer game when he designed the original Flower Shoppe that we knew we’d want more of his work. Flower Shoppe built on the base game by using Turn cards which direct how cards must be dealt (and taken) while letting the player decide how they’re actually assigned. It’s a great solo mode, but it’s still missing something that every Flower Shoppe should have: customers!

The new Customers expansion features 6 Customer cards, 2 of which are added to the deck between each round. Whenever a customer comes up, their unique ability will be resolved. Customers might reorganize the player’s arrangement, replace claimed cards, let the player sneak a peek at the opponent’s cards, or otherwise change the game. Not all of these abilities are helpful: sometimes the player will have to adjust on the fly. Just remember that the customer is always right!


Contents: 6 Customer cards

Rules

    During setup, shuffle two random customer cards into the Turn deck.
    If the first card revealed in any round is a customer, set it aside and resolve it after the


first turn.

    All customers must be resolved unless the effect description includes the word “may”.
    If there are no valid targets for an effect, it is ignored.
    After resolving a customer, it is removed from the game.
    Between rounds, shuffle two new random customers into

Name: This Game Will Make You Drink
Description:
Tomalo Vos ("This Game Will Make You Drink") is a game in which your goal is NOT to drink.

If you have the glass in front of you, play one of your cards to pass it on to another player. If you ran out of cards (or if all the cards you have are useless): Drink it yourself!

When you drink 3 times you are eliminated. The last to be eliminated is the winner.

Fast and fun but full of betrayal: just like your friendships.

Tomalo Vos is a responsible adult game that should not be played by anyone.

It includes rules to be played in a pandemic and it includes rules to play it without drinking anything.

Name: Strontium Dog: Bounty Hunter
Description:
These rules adapt Warlord Games’ Strontium Dog skirmish game for solo play. 
You take the role of a mutant Search/Destroy agent, tracking down wanted criminals across the universe.

Bounty Hunter is a miniâ€campaign using the Strontium Dog solo play rules, allowing you to play a series of interlocking games.
Of course, if you prefer you can easily adapt this miniâ€campaign to the regular rules for Strontium Dog, playing against your friends faceâ€toâ€face.

You’ll need the following to play Bounty Hunter:

     Various Strontium Dog models. You can easily adapt the game to suit your own model collection.
     Terrain representing the battleground, and a surface to play on – a 3’ x 3’ tabletop should suffice, although the scenarios are best played on a 4’ x 4’ area.
     The Strontium Dog rules, and necessary gaming paraphernalia (dice, etc.)
     The various cards (Confrontation cards, Foe cards and Friend cards) needed for the solo play version of Strontium Dog – you can find these on pages 20â€34 of the rules (print them out, cut them out and reinforce them by glueing them to card).


Before you begin the game, you’ll first have to create a Strontium Dog who will represent you, scouring the galaxy for criminals. This process is described in full in the campaign rules.

–description from the publisher

Name: HEXano
Description:
Using hexagonal tiles, race against your opponents to score points and be the first to finish their pattern.
Boasting fast paced, strategic gameplay and stunning artwork, HEXano is the latest game from the creator of the Unoriginal Card Game.

Tessellation and pattern recognition are key aspects of the game making it not just a easy game to learn, but also a fun way to educate children in these subjects!

—description from the designer

Name: Plucky Penguins: Merry Christmas Promo
Description: Merry Christmas promo card, reading: Santa Penguin gives you 2 fish and wishes you a Merry Christmas!

Name: ignition:core
Description:
ignition:core is an anime themed, miniatures based, skirmish tactics game of combat and board control.

Each player assumes the role of Armored Fireteam Leader (or Armored Raid Leader) commanding a team of combat specialists in a mission to claim valuable resources and territory on behalf of their faction/benefactors in the world of Isalia.

Destroying all that you see may seem appealing, but the narrow road to victory will demand smarter tactical decisions. Understanding the mission, your environment and the terrain and resources is key to victory.

ignition:core is a low model count, high model quality approach to tactical miniatures gaming in an ever evolving world. All rulebooks, data-cards and updates are free.

—description from publisher

Name: Galleys: Lepanto 1571 – Fast Play Rules for 16th century galley warfare
Description:
Rules for refighting the great galley battles of the 15th and 16th century in the Mediterranean.

The rules include all types of galley from the smallest right up to the giant Galleases of which only a few were built but were the dreadnought of their day. 
Both cannon fire and boarding rules are included.

—description from the publisher

1/1200 scale models to go with these rules are available from the publisher

Name: Flitter
Description: A card game about capturing the attention of hummingbirds. Draw in the most valuable birds

Name: Galleon 1500-1600: The Spanish Armada
Description:
These rules cover the Spanish Armada period in the Atlantic.

These are designed for 1/400th scale model ships.

A5 size booklet Rules come with turning circles. 
PDF ships sheets for England, Spain and Portugal. Race built galleons, Great ships and Carracks are available from the publisher.

—description from the publisher

Several ship models are available from the publisher

Name: Ironclads 1860-1918: Rules
Description:
This set covers 1860 to 1890 and covers the time before quick firing guns and destroyers, torpedoes and machine guns on ships.

A5 size booklet Rules come with turning circles.
PDF of ship sheets for British, French and Italian ships, reload counters and speed counters available from the publisher.

–description from the publisher

Name: Anno Domini 1666: The Locals – Thugs
Description:
Anno Domini 1666 is not only a world of brave heroes, but also the home of less powerful characters. Not amazing fencers, deadly marksmen, or powerful wizards; but their skills may still save the day. Thugs are perfect cannon fodder: They are cheap, fight fairly well, and can also provide the connections needed to hire mercenaries.

4 detailed plastic characters 
4 Character cards 
4 item cards

Name: Anno Domini 1666: The Locals – Footmen
Description:
Anno Domini 1666 is not only a world of brave, powerful heroes, but also the home of less powerful characters.

Thanks to their breastplates and helmets Footmen can survive hits which could kill other characters. Long glaive polearms provide them advantage in close combat, and pistols allow them to fight from a distance.

4 detailed plastic miniatures 
4 character cards
16 item cards

Name: Anno Domini 1666: Order of the Broken Cross – Knechts
Description:
The Knechts of the order are devout cultists. By day, some of them pose as regular members of the Teutonic Order. When carrying out missions for their true masters, The Order of the Broken Cross, they wear masks and hooded cloaks to conceal their identities. They use crossbows instead of forearms, since they are far quieter.

3 detailed plastic miniatures 
6 character cards
9 item cards

Name: Albania: The Epic Italian Invasion of Greece
Description:
This is a two player wargame covering the titular invasion. It is a divisional game, according to the rules, and turns are one week each. A map scale is not given.

The rules leave a lot of basic movement and combat procedures unspoken (it is stated that familiarity with other games is assumed). Many rules are devoted to the difficulties of moving, fighting, and supplying units in the mountainous terrain.

The game generally lasts for 12 turns but may be extended up to 16 by the Italian player at a cost of 15 victory points per turn. Victory points are earned by eliminating opposing units, holding certain cities, and (for the Italians) exiting certain parts of the map.

Fixed reinforcements enter on the second turn and the Italians may bring in optional reinforcements later at a cost. A few British units and RAF support may appear later as well.

The game can be combined with Egypt: David vs. Goliath â€“ The Italian-African Campaign and Crete, Gibraltar, & Malta.

Name: Streams Cross
Description:
In Streams Cross, players aim to score points by filling out a cross shaped grid with numbers.  Players earn more points for longer sequences where numbers do not decrease.

The game presents two rule sets for determining how the numbers are chosen.  In one, a set of dice are rolled (with a different amount rolled depending upon the round).  In the other, the players' finger(s) are used.

In either case, after the players have filled out 20 numbers, they sum their points and the player with the most points wins.

Name: Ironclads 1860-1918: South American Wars
Description:
Ironclads 1860-1918: South American Wars covers the South American Wars of Independence.
These include ship sheets by pdf for Spain, Chile, Peru, Ecuador, Argentina, Brazil, Mexico, Uruguay, Paraguay and Venezuela.

A5 size booklet Rules come with turning circles.
PDF ship sheets for ships, reload counters and speed counters available by email from publisher.

1/1200 scale models to go with these ship sheets are available from the publisher
Families: History: Latin American Wars of Independence

Name: SNAX
Description:
SNAX is card game that uses a deck of cards numbered 1 to 7 in four suits.  On their turn, a player can either play or pass.  Eligible cards to play are determined based upon the suit and color of the last card played.  A round continues until all players have passed.

However, points are awarded based upon bids made by each player prior to the start of card play. Players make a prediction for both the color and number of the last card.

The player with the most points after 5 rounds is the winner.

Name: Ironclads 1860-1918: Gulf of Riga 1917
Description:
This set covers the fascinating little war between the Germans and Russians in 1917. 
With Russia crumbling and in a revolutionary state the Germans tried to push into the gulf of Riga to support their armies while the Russian navy tried to stop them. While the Germans appear to have overwhelming power with many dreadnoughts the Russians have vast mine barriers and the shallow waters of the Gulf of Riga on their side. Russian shore batteries are also very effective while they are manned by loyal crews. Ship sheets for both the Russian Baltic fleets and the Russian Army shore batteries as well as the German navy are included.

A5 size booklet Rules come with shooting charts and turning circles. PDF ship sheets for Russian ships and batteries and German ships, reload counters, speed counters and fortifications sheets to cover the Turkish defences. These rules also cover naval war in limited visibility, forts and shore defences, mines, and crew quality.

—description from the publisher

1/1200 scale models also available from publisher

Name: Ironclads 1860-1918: Turkey 1914 to 1917
Description:
This covers the war with Russia in the Black Sea as well as the allied bombardment of the Dardanelles. 
See if you can force a passage through to Constantinople and end the war or the ultimate prize can you sink the Goeben...

A5 size booklet Rules come with turning circles.
PDF ship sheets for Britain, France, Russia, Turkey and Bulgaria ships, reload counters and speed counters are available by email from the publisher.

You don't need the main Ironclads 1860-1918 rules to play this war-game as all relevant rules are included in this set.

—description from the publisher

1/1200 scale models also available from publisher

Name: Ironclads 1860-1918: American Civil War Supplement
Description:
These also include mines, visibility and night fighting and include ship PDF sheets for both the Union and Confederacy.
These rules also cover naval war in rivers, limited visibility, forts and shore defences, mines, spar torpedo boats and interaction with land forces.

A5 size booklet Rules come with turning circles. 
PDF ship sheets for Union and Confederate ships, reload counters and speed counters are available from the publisher.

The main Ironclads 1860 - 1918 rules are not needed to play this war-game as all relevant rules are included in this set.

–description from the publisher

Name: Unraveled
Description:
A 1 vs many evidence analysis game.

The conspirator has an agenda, and it all hinges on one key piece of evidence. The evidence cards comes in three different types, colors, and fills, for a total of 27 unique cards. One is the key evidence the conspirator must hide in plain sight.


Type        Fill     Colors
Document    Solid    Salmon
Testimony   Spotty   Navy Blue
Exhibit     Hollow   Golden

The sleuths can examine the evidence, confirming if it shares any traits with the key evidence. But every move gives the conspirator more time and fuel to actuate their plan.

To complicate things, some of the sleuths may discover that they're loyal to the conspirator, and instead wish to enable their plot, and sabotage the investigation.

Name: The Sun Traffic Game
Description:
A board game from the 1930's that teaches Australian children road safety as they travel from home to school and return home again. Up to 4 players follow a numbered path of red or yellow squares along a road that crosses train, tram and other intersections. Movement is by throw of a dice and landing on a red square will incur a penalty. First to return home is the winner

Produced most likely as a supplement in "The Sun News Pictorial" which was a popular morning tabloid newspaper distributed in Melbourne and Victoria, Australia.

The game states the following " This game is made available by the Sun News Pictorial in co-operation with the National Safety Council for the promotion of a better understanding of traffic rules and regulations among children".

A second and probably original version was produced by the National Safety Council of Australia and differs slightly in the text in the left column and in the advertising signage near the train and playground

—user summary;;

Name: Sword & Sorcery: Ancient Chronicles – Ghost Soul Form Heroes
Description:
The Sword & Sorcery: Ancient Chronicles – Ghost Soul Form Heroes pack includes double-sided Background Talent cards allowing optional additional talents to heroes. It also includes a set of miniatures to replace the figures of the heroes while in ghost soul form.

Included as an add-on in the original Sword & Sorcery: Ancient Chronicles Kickstarter campaign.

Name: Tannenberg 1914
Description:
Description:
The game covers the initial stages of World War I, on the northern part of the Eastern front. It is divided in four scenarios, covering different stages of the battle. Each stage has different objectives, marked by victory points. Supply plays a key role, when planning offensives. While Russians enjoy numerical advantage (at least initially), Germany is well fortified and has access to rail transportation.

Rules:
The game is using the WB-95 system, which contains additions related to the time period. This rule-set is the base for WB-48.

Rules available in Polish and English.

Original game description from publishers site:
The 1st Army of General Rennenkampf attacked from the east and the 2nd Army of General Samsonov attacked from the south. The numerical superiority of the Russians seemed be a guarantee of success, but shortages of supply and lack of cooperation between both high commanders led to the complete defeat. The Germans managed to destroy both Russian armies in the separate battles.

—user summary
Families: Series: Wielkie Bitwy 1939-45 (Dragon / Taktyka i Strategia)

Name: Whodunnit?: Mystery at the Museum
Description:
Two crimes have been committed at the National Museum. Can you be the first to figure out WHO took WHAT priceless treasure, and hid it WHERE within the Museum? How are your detective skills?

Who Dunnit? Mystery at the Museum is a classic deduction game with twists and turns along the way. Put your detective hat on and go head-to-head to determine who, what and where to figure out the crime before your opponent does.

Put your thinking caps on, learn to ask the right questions and get to the bottom of the case first becoming a master detective!

Name: iNZects
Description:
New Zealand has native creatures found nowhere else in the world, including some interesting insects.

Roll and choose your dice, draw insect tracks to connect the insects to their homes.

A roll-and-draw, print-and-play game with no downtime!

Name: Zeitreise durch das 20. Jahrhundert
Description:
The game aims to encourage players to talk about certain topics. The players (2 players each as a team if there are more than 4 players) move their game pieces over an abstract plan with colour fields and collect colour cards. These cards can be used on communication fields with corresponding colours. Blue communication fields allow to describe a typical word from the 20th century and the other players have to guess this word. On red squares, players are asked to comment on one of 4 topics.  Whoever has solved the tasks in all colours can enter the target field. Points are awarded for tasks solved, words guessed and the first player at the finish line.

—user summary

Name: Krimihaus
Description:
In a four-story house, a series of crimes happens that need to be solved. The players move through the house as investigating commissioners and search for the perpetrators on the basis of their written work assignments. The house can be variably rearranged for each game, so it always remains exciting. Reading comprehension, reading speed and reading are promoted playfully.

But also for children who are not yet reading, the game is not too short, because the cards are read to them.

Logical thinking and reasoning are trained, as the criminal is deduced from circumstantial evidence and the solution is determined.

—user summary

Name: Würfle dich gesund
Description:
The game is about dealing with the appetite for apples, chocolate, cigarettes, alcohol, medications and drugs. First, you put together your game piece from cards. Turning them over reveals the inner life, the organism, of the character on which the "stimulants" circulate. In addition to the luck of the dice, tactics also play a role in determining whether the character is in bad shape or whether you can help him break bad habits or get a grip on his alcohol problems.

There are situations in which health is put at risk or promoted.
To win you must have done the following things:

     you must have your own token on all the colored consumption playing fields
     you must not have a token on any of the sickness playing fields
     you must not have any more tokens on the black points or the supply bag
     the products on the target fields must be converted into apples.


—user summary

Name: Ironclads 1860-1918: Battle of Lissa Supplement
Description:
The Battle of Lissa and The Crimean War.

These also include fortifications and shore bombardments and include ship sheets by pdf for Italy, Austria, Russia, Britain and France as well as the major forts in Sevastopol.

A5 size booklet Rules come with turning circles.
PDF ship sheets for British, French and Italian ships, reload counters and speed counters available from publisher.

You don't need the main Ironclads 1860-1918 rules to play this war-game as all relevant rules are included in this set.

–description from the publisher

Name: Scout: Komm mit zum Einkaufen!
Description:
Whew, let's go shopping!
Have the shopping list and the money ready and off you go to the store. Fruit, vegetables, milk or bread - depending on where the character is, one thing can be obtained from the shopping list. The seller says what the goods cost. The first player to buy all the things on their shopping list wins this game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Mystery House: Adventures in a Box – The Lost Ship
Description:
You’re on a distant planet, you see a spaceship in front of you, but no traces of life. Your oxygen is running low.
You have no choice: you must enter!
An apparently uncontrolled ship lost in the deep space and a mysterious Artificial Intelligence — all of this awaits in The Lost Ship, a SCI-FI themed adventure for Mystery House.

Solve all the riddles, and  take back the control of the ship!

—description from the publisher

Name: Ironclads 1860-1918: Pre Dreadnought Wars Supplement
Description:
Ironclads 1860-1918: Pre Dreadnought Wars Supplement cover from the Spanish American wars, The Sino Japanese wars and TsuShima and include crew quality and ships sheets by pdf.

A5 size booklet Rules come with turning circles.
PDF ship sheets for Japan, Russia, China, Spain, Britain and America ships, reload counters and speed counters available by email from publisher.

Several ship models are available from the publisher.

Name: strategie
Description:
One player has the task of arming Austria and defending it successfully at the national borders against a deployment of the Western and Eastern powers (2 other players).
The available units are divided into infantry, pioneers, artillery, tanks, transport vehicles and aircraft with different moving ranges. Austria starts with 11 units of infantry and can gain new units if the Austrian Parliament agrees (random decision). The Western and Eastern powers must each combine their initially scattered units into formations and march to the Austrian border.
The Western and Eastern powers win if Austria cannot stop a march on the border. Austria wins if the last parliamentary decision has been taken.

—user summary

Name: Intel
Description:
Intel is a simple yet highly strategic card game about tracking the Agent card and leading others off its trail. Take turns playing cards to uproot information on others or sabotage them by stealing and swapping cards. Score points by correctly voting for who has the Agent at the end of the round. Whoever has the Agent itself scores even more points, but only if they successfully lead others off their trail!

As the end of round approaches, the stakes get higher and higher—every action taken affects who ends up with the Agent card, as well as who might know its location! Deceive your friends with mind games, reverse psychology, and other strategic plays to maximize your points.

That’s just the tip of the iceberg—keep an eye out for stray point cards, the valuable Asset card, the elusive Double Agent, and much more...

Name: Take It Serious: Stadt Land Unseriös
Description:
Categories / scattergories board game with 72 different and innovative categories for great fun, played according to the classical scattergories rules. The aim is to collect as many points per round as possible in order to win the game after 12 rounds. But beware, there might be two winners in the end:  one with the most points and the player who has best predicted his target number of points before the start of the game.

Das Stadt, Land, Fluss Spiel mit 72 abwechslungsreichen, lustigen und innovativen Kategorien für großen Spielspaß. Verpackt in einem praktischen DIN-A4 Block mit 50 Spielbögen. Gespielt wird nach den klassischen Stadt, Land, Fluss Regeln. Ziel ist es, möglichst viele Punkte je Runde zu sammeln, um das Spiel nach 12 Runden zu gewinnen. Doch Achtung es gewinnen zwei Spieler, der mit den meisten Punkten und der Spieler, der vor Beginn des Spiels seine Zielpunktzahl am besten vorhergesagt hat.

Name: Lost Ruins of Arnak: The Search for Professor Kutil
Description:
Find out what happened to professor Kutil and his missing team in this free, four-chapter solo campaign for Lost Ruins of Arnak. Available at https://arnak.game

The famous scholar's expedition vanished somewhere in the uncharted waters of the Pacific Ocean—while searching for a mysterious island nobody believed existed. It seems the professor may have found what he was looking for, but what happened to his expedition? Only scarce traces of the team’s presence remain, but nothing truly explains where they are or what happened to them.

Discover the story of the lost expedition while beating your former student-turned-rival, who arrived on the island with her own unknown agenda, making your search for professor Kutil and his team more complicated.

To play the campaign, you will need a copy of Lost Ruins of Arnak and access to our free web application, which will guide you through the campaign setup, rules, and story. The app is playable on both computers and mobile devices. If you don’t want to play the campaign with the app, you can print it out with a free print-and-play file.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sumos al Ataque
Description:
Every year the best sumos fighters meet, in search of winning 2 of 3 matches, a card game that simulates sumos fights, pushes your rival, knocks him down, gets energy by eating, and prevents the referee from disqualifying you for doing trap.

How do you play? Each player chooses three actions, has two meeples (sumos), and a maximum of four cards in hand, from which they draw from a deck and discard the ones they use.

How do the players do the actions described with the cards?
With the cards moving to his meeple (sumo), he can attack, push, knock down, cheat, he can also draw a card or reserve it to play later.

How do you win?
There are three victory conditions, the one who takes the sumo off the floor, the one who shoots a sumo twice, the one who gets caught cheating.

Cada año los mejores peleadores de sumos se reúnen, en busca de ganar 2 de 3 enfrentamientos, un juego de cartas que simula las peleas de sumos, empuja a tu rival, derríbalo, obtén energía comiendo, y evita que el arbitro te descalifique por hacer trampa.

¿Cómo se juega? Cada jugador escoge tres acciones, cuenta con dos meeples (sumos), y cuatro cartas  máximo en mano, de las cuales va sacando de un mazo y descartan las que usen.

¿Cómo hacen los jugadores las acciones descritas con las cartas? 
Con las cartas mueven a su meeple (sumo), puede atacar, empujar, derribar,  hacer trampa, también puede sacar carta o reservarla para jugar después.

¿Cómo se gana? 
hay tres condiciones de victoria, el que saque al sumo de la duela, el que tire dos veces a un sumo, el que lo cachen haciendo trampa.

Name: Ironclads 1860-1918: Scenarios Vol 1
Description:
Ironclads 1860-1918: Scenarios Vol 1 This set of rules includes one scenario for each of the following sets of rules, Ironclads 1860 to 1918:

     Lissa and the Crimea,
     American Civil war,
     South American wars of independence,
     Pre dreadnought wars,
     Turkey in the black sea ,
     The gulf of Riga 1917. 


There are some additional rules and ship sheets included in this set.

Name: Fast Play WWI Fleet Actions: Jutland 1918 Scenario
Description:
These rules are for use with very large scale fleet actions. They give the possibility of refighting an action as large as the battle of Jutland in just a few hours. 
They include full information to fight with the ships that existed at the time in the squadrons they were actually in. 
Counter sets for each squadron are available by email once you have bought the rules.

What if Jutland had been refought in 1918 as the German High Command wanted to. 
By this time both fleets were vastly different to those that fought at Jutland in 1916. 
The British had 12 major warships with 15” guns and the Germans had their own 15” gunned dreadnoughts available. The British also had two whole units of aircraft carriers with torpedo dropping planes. The Germans had shore based aircraft and Zeppelins. 
Rules include all ships in the Grand fleet and the High Seas Fleet as they were in 1918 as well as aircraft, submarines and aircraft carriers.

A PDF file of ship counters is also available by email from the publisher.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fast Play WWI Fleet Actions: Mediterranean Navies Scenario
Description:
These rules are for use with very large scale fleet actions. They give the possibility of refighting an action as large as the battle of Jutland in just a few hours. 
They include full information to fight with the ships that existed at the time in the squadrons they were actually in. Counter sets for each squadron are available by email once you have bought the rules.

These cover all the navies of the Mediterranean including navies of France, Italy, Austria Hungry, Turkey and some British and German ships.

—description from the publisher

Name: Age of Dogfights: WWII
Description:
The game depicts air battles during WWII in a very realistic way. A special quality of the game are the altitude stands that are easy to handle. The game covers the period of the war from 1942 to 1945 in Europe, when the USA became heavily involved in the war. The game uses the Triangle system, which is very flexible and allows many optional rules to be applied. The mechanics of the game allow simulation of battles with a large number of individual aircraft, with a fluid gameplay.

The game may seem too simple at first sight, as most of the mechanics are numbers (speed, agility, firepower, etc.) which are modified by dice and several factors. However, while being easy to use, the basically simple mechanics form a very realistic set of physics, which simulate velocity, direction changing (both horizontal and vertical) and damage inflicted by firing.

—description from the designer
Families: Series: Triangle System (Predrag Lazovic / Dragan Lazovic)

Name: Animals and Legends Card Game
Description:
Animals & Legends is a clever new card game created by a father and son team. This is a deck-building game with a twist that allows from 2 to 4 players to engage in friendly competition with the winner being the last one with their collection of animal cards.

The essence of Animals & Legends is to create a team animals an mythical creatures and then pit them against your opponent in battle. All players can create teams filled with fun, exciting creatures and duke it out using a little luck along with enough strategy to keep the interest of kids and adults alike. You win the game by destroying or stealing animal cards that are held by opposing players.

—description from the designer

Name: ケータイ少女～MNPするから金をくれっ! (Give me money because I'm MNP! )
Description:
In Give me money, players get smartphones for free with the MNP (Mobile Number Portability). You need to trick the portability system to get smartphones for free. The players are kids who will try to take advantage of the system and earn money by changing phone companies.

We are playing with three different operators (colors). Each of them will offer phones to pick up when taking out contracts. These phones have different values and therefore will be more or less attractive to gamers.

The cards are separated by operators and form three piles. At the start of the game a market is created by drawing as many cards as there are players in each operator deck (with two players two cards per operator so six in total).

A round is made up of several phases. The game ends when you can no longer replenish the market. The final count is simple: add the yen tokens (1 point each) and the value of the cards and the winner is the one with the most points.

Possibly a spin-off from the Keitai Shoujo romance game app.

—user summary

Name: Operation Market Garden: Scenario 1 – XXX Corps Breakout: For Rapid Fire! Rules
Description:
All the information needed for the first scenario from the Operation Market Garden Battlegroups and Battlegames book published in 2020.

This game simulates the initial breakout by the Irish Group under the cover of the rolling barrage.

The PDF also includes vehicle and gun statistics for the Reloaded version of Rapid Fire rules.

—description from the publisher

Name: Rapid Fire Reloaded: Fast Play Wargaming Rules for World War Two Land Battles
Description:
Rapid Fire Reloaded is the latest version of the Rapid Fire basic rules for W.W.2 wargaming with miniatures. 
The original fast play rules are now even faster, with new, easy to remember mechanisms and streamlined systems. 
Play using the standard Rapid Fire 1:15 figure and 1:5 vehicle ratios for brigade-level engagements, or use for 1:1 skirmishes or even 1:45/1:15 divisional level battles.

     Handy A5 size booklet you can hold in one hand during games
     Fully compatible with the advanced rules section of Rapid Fire!
     Easy to pick up for experienced Rapid Fire players and ideal for newcomers to RF.
     Free online ‘Reloaded’ vehicle and gun charts for many nations.
     Includes two battlegrouped, points-balanced forces and a Normandy scenario that you can play to ‘action learn’ the rules
     16 pages packed with rules, rules, rules! 


—description from the publisher

Name: Cinder Shire
Description:
Cinder Shire is a competitive collection game made for 2 to 4 players.

You and your friends have all received a letter with an offer of glorious treasures and wealth to the first one to complete a full collection of magically imbued artifacts.

In Cinder Shire, you and your friends will delve deep into a magical abandoned dungeon that can imbue lost artifacts with its magic.

Every Attempt to map out the dungeon has lead to failure, some say that the magic makes the walls shift when no living soul is within.

Be the first to complete a full gear set and claim the key to the castle and all that lies within.

But be careful the dungeon can sense your presence, each time you enter, the dungeon will react.

Use the magical items you've collected to your advantage or to your friends' disadvantage.

Cinder Shire comes with 19 different consumable cards 54 unique gear cards each providing a unique ability or effects all with custom-made high fidelity artwork especially made to make Cinder Shire the most unique board game on the market
Each game has been carefully assembled to provide the most immersive experience of a fantasy medieval experience.

—description from the designer

Name: Aduanas y aranceles
Description:
Game of economy, about world trade, ships, exports and imports, empires are destroyed and now they are forced to trade to prosper, they have been transformed into countries, each one has a resource, to trade.

How do you play and win the game?
Each country produces a resource, has two ships, each one has a personal board with its customs area and character card. The objective is to send ships to other countries to buy resources, or if you go to islands you can steal resources, and then unload them at customs, these resources are exchanged for resource cards, the first country that collects three cards wins.

How do players trade?
If a ship arrives in a country, it has the option of buying resources, which are guided by the market price. If there are many resources it will be sold cheaply and if there are few resources it will be sold high.

What are the players doing?
Each player must send ships, to gather the resources or play the event cards (war, tariffs, exchange) that will serve to ruin the plans of the other countries, when you gather the resources that the resource cards ask for, you take it.

Juego de economía, sobre comercio mundial, barcos, exportaciones e importaciones, los imperios están destruidos y ahora están obligados a comerciar para prosperar, se han transformado en países.

¿Cómo se juega y gana el juego?
cada país produce un recurso,  cuenta con dos barcos, cada uno tiene un tablero personal con su zona de aduana y carta de personaje. El objetivo es  enviar barcos a otros países para comprar recursos, o si va a islas puede robar recursos, para después descargarlos en la aduana, estos recursos se canjean por unas cartas de recursos, el primer país que junte tres cartas gana.

¿Cómo comercian los jugadores?
si un barco llega a un país tiene la opción de comprar recursos, los cuales se guían por el precio del mercado, si hay muchos recursos se venderá barato y si hay pocos recursos se venderá caro.

¿Lo que hacen los jugadores?
cada jugador deberá enviar barcos, para juntar los recursos o jugar las cartas de evento (guerra, aranceles, intercambio) que servirán para arruinar los planes de los demás países, cuando juntes los recursos que pide las cartas de recursos, te la llevas.

Name: Operation Market Garden: Scenario 2 – Attack of Panzer Brigade 107: For Rapid Fire! Rules
Description:
German attempts to secure the Bailey Bridge crossing of the Wihelmina Canal at Son.

A merger of the events of the 19th and 20th September.

The PDF also includes vehicle and gun statistics for the Reloaded version of Rapid Fire rules.

—description from the publisher

Name: ぺたぺた (Petapeta)
Description:
ãºãŸãºãŸ (Petapeta) is an area majority game where the players attach stickers to seven areas on a sheet of paper.  The game includes several board variations, and the areas of each board are different sizes for different player counts.

The actions in the game center around a rondel.  Each space allows the player to place one or two stickers in a single area on this game's board.  Some stickers are a player's color and others are a neutral color.

The game ends when all players cannot place additional stickers.  Points are earned for the number of large colored stickers placed; number of different areas with colored stickers; and most colored stickers in each area.  The player with the most points wins.

Name: Operation Market Garden: Scenario 3 – Assault on the Waal: For Rapid Fire! Rules
Description:
The Allied attempt to secure a bridgehead over the river Waal at Nijmegen.

The PDF also includes vehicle and gun statistics for the Reloaded version of Rapid Fire rules.

—description from the publisher

Name: Operation Market Garden: Scenario 4 – The Final Push: For Rapid Fire! Rules
Description:
The Allied dash to clear the way to the Arnhem road bridge and link up with the Poles at Driel.

The PDF also includes vehicle and gun statistics for the Reloaded version of Rapid Fire rules.

—description from the publisher

Name: Operation Market Garden: Scenario 5 – Charge of the Paras: For Rapid Fire! Rules
Description:
1st Airborne’s attempt to break through to 2 Para’s precarious hold of the Arnhem road bridge.

The PDF also includes vehicle and gun statistics for the Reloaded version of Rapid Fire rules.

—description from the publisher

Name: Operation Market Garden: Scenario 6 – Out of Ammunition: God Save the King – For Rapid Fire! Rules
Description:
Colonel Frost must hold on to their bridgehead until reinforced by the rest of the the Division.

The PDF also includes vehicle and gun statistics for the Reloaded version of Rapid Fire rules.

—description from the publisher

Name: Flying Colors: Beat to Quarters!
Description:
Beat to Quarters is an official expansion to Flying Colors by GMT Games, LLC and requires a copy of that game (preferably the latest deluxe edition) to play.

One of the most common criticisms of Flying Colors is the clutter of status markers on the map and that they may detract from game play. This concern can be minimized somewhat by using status sheets and a handy pencil to keep track of things on paper. This, however, adds a separate record-keeping aspect that the design of the game goes out of its way to avoid.

Beat to Quarters provides the ultimate way by which to keep track of the status of individual ships through the use of individual tracking cards that are kept conveniently near the map and that are laid out to conveniently hold a variety of status markers such as Broadsides Fired, Sail State, Rigging Damage, and Hull Damage. The cards are designed to be printed at a standard 3.5 by 2.5 inch size so that they can be slipped into card protectors for extended usage.

Individual tracking cards are included for all 562 individually named ships included with the latest, deluxe version of Flying Colors. But that’s not all!

As a bonus, Beat to Quarters also includes the print-and-play components for an entirely new way to play Flying Colors. Drawing from games such as Naval War, Modern Naval Battles, and (in particular) Enemy in Sight, Beat to Quarters can be played with just the ship tracking cards, a special set of markers and 8.5 x 11 inch tracking board, and the status markers from Flying Colors. The ship cards are organized into squadrons that maneuver and fire against the opposing fleet within a relatively small playing area. With Beat to Quarters, you can play the battle of Trafalgar without the space requirements for three game maps.

With Beat to Quarters, you can either enhance or completely change your enjoyment of Flying Colors!

—description from the publisher

Beat to Quarters can be purchased from:

 Volume I - Flying Colors
 Volume II - Serpents-of-the-Seas

Name: Metal Mickey: All Around the House Game
Description:
Each player receives 13 figures to be placed on a 6x6 board (the house) with point from 3 to 8. The figures are placed alternately. They have to be placed horizontally or vertically in line with the previous figure. No other piece may be on this line. As soon as a player can no longer place a piece according to the rules, the other player wins the game with as many points as the last square he occupied. The player to score at least 17 points by winning several games wins the match.

—user summary

Name: Blumenwiese
Description:
The players are walking on the flower meadow and want to pick flowers. Before one can be taken away, however, a flower of the same color must first be brought to bloom in another part of the meadow.

When all the flowers have been picked, the game is over. Whoever has picked the most flowers is the winner. If the number is the same, the corresponding players have won together.

—user summary

Name: HypoVision
Description:
The players move their game pieces across 3 islands and are asked questions on the topics of economy, banking, sport, art, environment and "Hypo-Bank", the correct answers to which earn points. Changing the islands increases the multiplier for the points paid out (1x, 2x, 3x). In addition, there are events that influence the score. The game ends after a previously agreed playing time or when a certain score has been reached by a player. The player with the most points wins.

—user summary

Name: Sandwich Masters: Bread Roles
Description:
Bread Roles brings an added layer of chaos to the classic Sandwich Masters experience by introducing 10 new role cards, each of which boasts unique game-bending powers. What's more, Bread Roles allows six people to play together for the first time by adding extra cards to the core game.

Assume the identity of the Undercover Health Inspector, Flavatron 5000 or Colin the Bear (among others) and let battle commence. Your name may have changed but the challenge remains the same: defeat your rivals and become the one true Sandwich Master!

—description from the publisher

Name: Mobility
Description:
The aim of the game is to keep greenhouse gas emissions from transport as low as possible in real-life examples. The means of transport available in the game are bicycle, train, underground, tram, ferry, electric car, bus, hybrid car, conventional car or plane, each of which has its specific CO2 equivalent per person-kilometre. The players should now find a suitable solution for the annual mileage in a case study of a fictitious person (commute to work, holidays, leisure time, excursions). The player or game group that proposes a practicable solution with the lowest emission wins the game. Different large wooden cubes are used for a vivid representation of the emissions.

—user summary

Name: Mondgewitter
Description:
You place cards with clouds, green and yellow moons, lightning or black holes in a spiral on the crescent moon. In your turn, you lay a maximum of three cards and move your figure. Edges must match when you lay cards. If you cannot or do not want to lay cards, you draw a card. Restrictions apply to the laying of the individual motifs. Cards laid during the turn determine the movement range of the piece. At the end of the spiral, you turn around; on clouds, opposing pieces are captured and special rules apply again for some motifs. In a game of two, you win if you are not at the end of the spiral, otherwise you win if you have moved the furthest.

—user summary

Name: ASTER
Description: ASTER is a game of intuition and spatial logic (for 2 to 4 players), in which you will have to generate, move on the map and destroy stars with a single objective: to reconstruct the constellations as we see them from the terrestrial perspective and claim them before the other players.

Name: Guardians of Fire
Description:
Guardians of Fire is an immersive combat exploration game for 2-5 players set in mythological ancient Persia. 
It challenges 4 Heroes in chronicled adventures against the Angra Mainyu, the source of all evil.

The game system is an RPG / Dungeon-Crawl. There are six missions, and after each event, each player can improve their abilities and get more gifts.

At the end of each chronicle, 2 events will take place, and they depend on which side wins the game. The time for completing each mission is about 60-90 minutes.

Each game involves an action-packed fight where two sides face off. One of the players assumes the role of the dark side and controls the army of Ahriman. The remaining players take control of the Heroes, who must work together as a team to stop the darkness. Each side takes turns, pitting their strategies against each other in order to achieve their objectives.

—description from the publisher

Name: Scots Raid: A Solo Game
Description:
Set in the Dark Ages you command a small force of Scots raiding across the border into the lands of the Anglo-Saxons, the game is played over two scenarios the raid itself and the escape as you try to outrun the pursuing Anglo-Saxon forces.

Ideal for 28mm figures but can be played in any scale as long as the figures are individually based.

Simple to play but the random events should make every game different.

Turn Sequence:

     Activate Scot forces
     Activate Anglo-Saxon forces
     Roll for Anglo-Saxon reinforcements
     Roll for random events


—description from the designer

Name: Shoeby Card Game
Description:
The game contains cards with numbers and 'actions' printed on them, in several colors plus a few jokers.

This game is closely related to Crazy Eights, UNO, KFC's Assano and KFC's Actiespel.
General game-play and basic rules are the same those games, the take-that cards might be different from specific versions of those games.

The purpose of the game is to get rid of your own hand cards first.  To do this, when it's your turn, you try to match on of your own cards with the color or symbol of the last played card.  Jokers are always valid to play, if you have them.  If you can't match, you draw a card from a shared draw pile.  If you can match that card, you can instantly play it.

The game-box contains 36 card, divided as follows:

     3 Cards with the rules in Dutch.
     9 Cards with number 1-9, plus 1 "buy-2" card, 1 "skip turn" card and 1 "reverse direction" card, in the color yellow.
     9 Cards with number 1-9, plus 1 "buy-2" card, 1 "skip turn" card and 1 "reverse direction" card, in the color blue.
     9 Cards with number 1-9, plus 1 "buy-2" card, 1 "skip turn" card and 1 "reverse direction" card, in the color green.
     9 Cards with number 1-9, plus 1 "buy-2" card, 1 "skip turn" card and 1 "reverse direction" card, in the color red.
     4 Colorless Cards with additional actions, 2 "take-4" cards, 3 "change color" card.


This game was published as part of a promotional campaign for the Shoeby clothes stores.

—user summary

Name: The Mermaid's Jewels: String Together A Treasure From The Sea
Description:
Mermaids have been swimming through the magical sea, collecting colorful jewels along the way. They have an overflowing treasure chest full of “pearls” and want you to join in on the fun. Can you string together enough of these treasures from
the sea to make your very own necklace?

Roll the die and collect pearls from the special, pearl-sorting treasure chest. Once you remove a pearl, all the other pearls will cascade down the lane. Look closely! Did any of the pearls form a chain reaction with two or more of the same colored pearls touching?

The first player to complete their necklace wins!

For a more challenging game, you can add the dangerous, dark green, seaweed colored pearls to the treasure chest. You’ll need to avoid getting “caught in the seaweed” and complete your necklace to win.

—description from the designer

Name: Food Truck Race
Description:
The city has decided to limit food trucks down to only one. That means the drivers/chefs have one day to race around downtown serving food on the fly to hungry customers to prove that their truck is the only one that deserves to stay in business.

Players have to manage their prep areas while racing to customers all over the downtown sidewalks in order to serve the most customers they can until everyone is fed. Each item on your truck has a set price, so you can keep track of how much money you're making in sales as the game progresses...

But there's more. At the end of the night, every food truck flips over the order cards that they delivered during the game and adds the tips to their haul of cash. Orders with a variety of items earn more tips, and the player driving the food truck with the most money wins.

—description from the designer

Name: Flames of War: Bagration – Axis-Allies: Hungarian, Romanian and Finnish forces on the Eastern Front 1944
Description:
This book contains:

     Background on the Finnish, Hungarian, and Romanian Armies during the epic battles for the Eastern Front in 1944 and 1945. 
     Instructions on how to build a Finnish T-26 Armoured Company, Sturmi Assault Gun Company and Infantry Company, or a Hungarian Panther Tank Company, Tiger Tank Company, Turán Tank Company, Panzer IV Tank Company, Zrinyi Assault Gun Company, StuG Assault Gun Company, Hetzer Assault Gun Company and Rifle Company, or a Romanian R-2 Light Tank Company, T-4 Medium Tank Company, TA Assault Gun Company, and Motorised Rifle Company.
     Painting and Basing guides.
     Three new Bagration themed Missions.


—description from the publisher

Name: Flames of War: Hungarian Starter Force – Assault Gun Battery
Description:
In 1944 Stalin’s Red army is on the attack. 
While it throws the Germans out of Byelorussia, it also goes about defeating Germany’s allies; Finland, Romania and Hungary. 
The Romanians hold off the first Soviet attacks, but a second massive offensive in August 1944 sees them overwhelmed. They surrender and swap sides to fight alongside the Soviets. 
Meanwhile, the Finns also fight for their survival as the Soviets attempt to steamroll them out of the war. They fight the Soviets to a standstill and agree a peace, but are forced to to turn on the Germans. 
Then three massive Soviet Fronts turn on Hungary, defended by six German and Hungarian armies. The great red sledgehammer is soon swinging, as the Soviets and Romanians launch an assault toward Budapest. Axis armoured forces attempt to stop the encirclement of the city. This savage and bitter struggle will last for 100 gruelling days.

—description from the publisher

Name: States of the USA
Description: Players identify states based on their flag, capitol, shape, or landmark. If a player correctly identifies a state, they get to answer a trivia question about the state.

Name: ベストフレンドShiitake. (BestFriendShiitake.)
Description:
BestFriendShiitake. is a special version of BestFriendS; a game that players can get to know more about each other by trying to come up with the answer that would best satisfy the question giver. The BestFriendShiitake. includes a special supplement book written by Shiitake., the Japanese popular fortune teller, and can be enjoyed as a psychological test.

In this game, players take turns one by one, and become a question giver. The giver draws a question card randomly from the draw pile, and announces the question written on it. There are questions like "What do I think is the must have food for picnic?" or "What do I want?" Other players write the answers that would most please the question giver according to the giver’s character and taste, and submit it to the giver. For example, you could write sandwitches, rice balls, or summer rolls for must have food for picnic.

When everyone's answers are submitted, the giver shuffles the answers and then looks at them secretly. This is the best moment in this game! Looking at the answers everyone wrote to please you makes you happy and blushing.

The giver ranks the answers depending on their subjectivity, reveals and announces the answers from the least accurate without identifying who has written what. It would be more fun if you comment when you reveal an answer. Lastly, announce the best one. Only the person who wrote that answer claims it, and they get the question card as a point.

Keep doing this, and the game ends after certain rounds. The person with the most question cards is the winner.

Name: 赤い糸大作戦 (Secret Admirer)
Description:
Secret Admirer is a game to send tiny letters to each other. Succeed the destiny challenge by confessing your love to someone who you believe sent you a love letter, or meddle in and try to hook other 2 players up.

On your turn, you send one of your letters to someone by tucking it to their post. The person who received it cannot look inside the letter yet.

Each player has 5 letters, and 2 of them are love letters. You send a love letter to someone who you like secretly. While players send letters to each other, if you think the person you sent a love letter also sent you a love letter back, then be brave and confess your love.

If they love you back, then you two try “love love challenge” and see if you can have everyone's celebration.

But be careful! If you are too shy, someone might meddle in!

Name: ナンテッタ (Nantetta)
Description:
Nantetta is a game of imagination. The title “Nantetta” means “What did you say?” in Japanese.

The active player chooses one of the cards on the table at heart. They think of the phrase that would go in the words balloon of that card, and announce it. Imagine in your own way by observing the character's expression and situation. What kind of phrase would be suitable to tell the feelings you came up with?

Other players imagine the feelings from the announced phrase, and search for the card that would be correct. The way the active player said it can be a hint. Look at the cards on the table carefully, and if you think you found it, take it as fast as possible. If you take the correct one, you get that card as a reward.

Players take turns one by one, imagining the feelings from the picture, and announce the phrase freely. Other players may sympathize, or get surprised.
Continue doing this, and the person who gets 5 cards first is the winner.
There's no wrong phrases or right phrases. It's important to announce the phrase you came up with.

On the other hand, you would feel very happy if others sympathize and understand what you meant. This experience of being understood helps them to think of the phrases that people can understand naturally.

Name: Missione Natura
Description:
Missione Natura Is a card game in which the player has to save more endangered animals he can.
At each turn one animal has to be played but only the more endangered or if they have the same value, the heavier wins.
Animals are also divided in habitats, so if animals of the same habit are played the last one wins independent of weight and endangered state.

—user summary

Name: Шакал Архипелаг: Остров Пятницы (Jackal Archipelago: Friday's island)
Description: Jackal Archipelago: Friday’ island is a new island for Jackal: Archipelago. It includes 11 new tiles, 4 coins, 4 bottles and Friday meeple.

Name: Stonelight: The Crazy Magic Tournament
Description:
Be part of a crazy magic tournament, where the chaos rules and up to 6 participants simultaneously collect resources and cast spells on each other, trying to sabotage each other's plans to collect 6 Magic Stones and win the game.

Stonelight is a fun-to-play game for 2 to 6 players in which everyone plays with unique Characters and Magic Familiars with the objective of collecting 6 Magic Stones before anyone else. The game is full of funny and mean spells awakening intense emotions and creating amusing moments during the entire match. Stealing resources and Magic Stones, changing the target of other people's spells, or creating big hurricanes to mess with everyone's Magic Stones is a usual thing in this game!

—description from the designer

Name: Pocket World Cup: The Rise of Antarctica
Description:
Global warming has transformed Antarctica from a winter wasteland into a holiday hotspot. As visitors flock to this newly-formed island nation, the governing authorities are looking to make a splash on the global stage and entice people to take up permanent residence. What better way to showcase this beautiful country than by becoming a world power in the beautiful game? Take the reins of the national football squad, use a recruiting loophole to pick some of the best players from around the globe, and lead Antarctica to World Cup glory in this challenging card-drafting, dice-chucking game for one!

In Pocket World Cup, you will play the role of team manager leading Antarctica through three years of World Cup qualifying. Each year you will draft 3 new players to your team and face 3 opponents in an attempt to earn momentum. Games are resolved by rolling dice for both sides, with each player offering additional dice or the ability to manipulate the dice in play. The players will get better as you progress from one year to the next, but so will your competition. If you earn enough momentum after three years, you will qualify for the World Cup: a 24-team single-elimination knockout tournament.

For a greater challenge, you can play in Dynasty Mode: a campaign of four complete cycles of qualifying games and World Cups in which you earn victory points based on how far you advance each cycle. Earn enough and your name will be etched forever in the Antarctican Hall of Fame!

—description from the designer

Name: Ostfriesen Roulette
Description:
Each player receives 5 dice. Whoever has dice left at the end loses, everyone else wins. 
A player starts by rolling 2 dice. If he throws a double, he must take them back. If he throws different numbers, they remain and he may throw one more of his remaining dice or pass. Then the other players follow. Every time a 6 is thrown, that die is removed from the game. If a number occurs twice, the player must take these dice back into his hand and it is the next player's turn.

—user summary

Name: Daniel und seine Freunde
Description:
The players move their game pieces along a route by rolling the dice and experience some events from the life of the prophet Daniel. In addition, 2 non-player figures move, the lion and the fire, which prevent the players from moving forward. On the way, lion cards and name cards can be collected, which bring additional points at the end of the game. The game ends when 2 players or 1 player and the lion figure have reached the goal, for which points are awarded. The player with the most points wins the game.

—user summary

Name: BattleTech: MapPack – Battle of Tukayyid
Description:
The map pack includes the following:

Four double sized, two sided map sheets

     Deployment Zone
     Kozice Valley (CDS)
     Lake Losije (CNC)
     Holth Forest (CGB)
     Racice River Delta (CSJ)
     Pozoristu Mountains (CW)
     Robyn's Crossing (CJF)
     Devil's Bath (CSV)


1 punchboard of fire and smoke counters
Location rulesheet

Name: Strategie 2000
Description:
Like in Chess, 2 players sit opposite each other and lead their pieces from an oil company (tankers, pipelines, oil tanks, drilling rigs, company boss and general manager) on an 8x8 board. The figures are assigned short (1 or 2) steps or long (any number) steps. At the beginning of each turn, a player receives income for some of his remaining figures and can then move 2 figures, but must pay for their movement. Opposing pieces are captured as in chess, but can be bought back. As soon as his group leader has been defeated or the player can no longer pay for piece movement, he loses.

—user summary

Name: The Endless Odyssey: A Mythic Storytelling Card Game
Description:
Fire your imagination with these fun Endless Odyssey storytelling cards. Reviving the Victorian craze for ‘myrioramas’, the 20 picture cards can be placed in any order to create seamless scenes. Almost infinite combinations of cards provide endless storyscaping possibilities.

Enter a strange land of winged horses and vengeful gods, where one-eyed monsters feast on human flesh. Perhaps you will stumble across buried treasure or receive a favourable prophecy, but watch out for the sinister boatman. He is waiting to transport you across the river, a journey from which no one has ever returned … Where will the story take you?

There are over two quintillion storyscaping possibilities, and you can build a seamless panorama stretching up to 5 1/2 feet!

—description from the publisher
